Class Equation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Equation

  • public class Equation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that models an equation, and its behaviour.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The list of factors for this equation.
      Node node
      The Node representing the whole equation.

      The raw equation.
      java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokens
      An ArrayList of tokens that represent RAW_EQ.

    • Field Detail

      • RAW_EQ

        public final java.lang.String RAW_EQ
        The raw equation.

      • tokens

        public java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokens
        An ArrayList of tokens that represent RAW_EQ. Generally unused after generating node.

      • node

        public Node node
        The Node representing the whole equation. It is tokens, but put into a hierarchy.
        See Also:
        generateNodes(ArrayList)

      • factors

        public Factors factors
        The list of factors for this equation. This includes what values variables are, and where to find what functions do.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Equation

        public Equation()
        The default constructor for the Equation class. Just passes null to the main constructor.

      • Equation

        public Equation(java.lang.String pEq)
        The main constructor for the equaiton class. Takes the parameter pEq, and parses the tokens from it, and generates a Node model for it.
        Parameters:
        pEq - A string containing the equation that this class will be modeled after.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws NotDefinedException,
                        TypeMisMatchException
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException
        TypeMisMatchException

      • eval

        public static double eval(Factors pFactor,
                          Node pNode)
                   throws NotDefinedException
        Evaluates pNode using pFactor.
        Parameters:
        pFactor - The factors (variable values and function definitions) that will be used to evaluate pNode.
        pNode - The node that will be evaluated using pFactor.
        Returns:
        A numerical representation of pNode, when evaluated using pFactor.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException - Thrown if either a variable or a function wasn't defined.
        See Also:
        Factors.eval(Node)

      • eval

        public static double eval(Factors pFactor,
                          Node pNode,
                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> pVars)
                   throws NotDefinedException
        Evaluates pNode using pFactor and pVars.
        Parameters:
        pFactor - The factors (variable values and function definitions) that will be used to evaluate pNode.
        pNode - The node that will be evaluated using pFactor.
        pVars - Used instead of pFactor's vars if a conflict between the two arises.
        Returns:
        A numerical representation of pNode, when evaluated using pFactor, and pVars.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException - Thrown if either a variable or a function wans't defined.
        See Also:
        Factors.eval(Node, HashMap)

      • eval

        public double eval()
            throws NotDefinedException
        Evaluates node using factors.
        Returns:
        A numerical representation of node, when evaluated using factors.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException - Thrown if either a variable or a function wasn't defined.
        See Also:
        eval(Factors, Node)

      • eval

        public double eval(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> pVars)
            throws NotDefinedException
        Evaluates node using factors and pVars.
        Parameters:
        pVars - Used instead of factors's vars if a conflict between the two arises.
        Returns:
        A numerical representation of node, when evaluated using factors and pVars.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException - Thrown if either a variable or a function wasn't defined.
        See Also:
        eval(Factors, Node, HashMap)

      • isAlphaNumP

        public static boolean isAlphaNumP(char c)
        Checks if a character is alphanumeric or a period.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to test.
        Returns:
        True if the character is alphanumeric or a period. False otherwise.

      • isAlphaNumP

        public static boolean isAlphaNumP(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if a string consists only of letters, digits, and / or periods.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to test.
        Returns:
        True if the string consists only of letters, digits, and / or periods. False otherwise.

        Checks if a character is a letter.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if the character is a letter. False otherwise.

      • isAlpha

        public static boolean isAlpha(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if a string consists only of letters.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to test.
        Returns:
        True if the String is only letters. False otherwise.

      • isNumP

        public static boolean isNumP(char c)
        Checks if a character is a digit or period.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to test.
        Returns:
        True if the character is a digit or period. False otherwise.

      • isNumP

        public static boolean isNumP(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if a string consists only of digits and / or periods. Please note that this doesn't check to make sure there _are_ digits. So "...." will return true.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to test.
        Returns:
        True if the String is only digits and / or periods. False otherwise.
